excerpt: Accessible via cable car or hiking trail, this 1,096-ft. mount is a popular lookout for city lights.
detail_description: Mount Hakodate, standing at 1,096 feet tall, is a popular spot for taking in stunning city views. Accessible by cable car or hiking trail, it offers a breathtaking panorama of the city lights below. The area also holds historical significance as a cemetery for foreigners with Western religious beliefs dating back to the late 19th century.
name: Mount Hakodate

excerpt: Quaint shopping mall in a circa-1869 warehouse complex, with restuarants, groceries & gifts.
detail_description: Discover a charming shopping destination with a rich history at the Kanemori Red Brick Warehouse in Hakodate. This circa-1869 warehouse complex has been transformed into a bustling commercial district, offering an array of shops where you can find local snacks, sweets, and unique clothing and accessories. As one of the first ports in Japan to open to foreign trade, Hakodate boasts a long commercial history, and the red brick warehouses along the bay serve as a testament to this legacy.
name: Kanemori Red Brick Warehouse

excerpt: This 107-m. tower has an observatory with views of mountains & the star-shaped fort below.
detail_description: Goryōkaku Tower, standing at 107 meters tall, features an observatory offering stunning views of the star-shaped fort below and the surrounding mountains. The fortress was strategically designed to accommodate more gun turrets and minimize blind spots along its walls. Visitors can take a lift to the observation deck for panoramic vistas before exploring other nearby attractions such as Mount Hakodate, Hakodate Morning Market, and Onuma Quasi-National Park.
name: Goryōkaku Tower

detail_description: The Hakodate Morning Market, also known as Asaichi, is a must-visit attraction in Hakodate. Located near the main train station, it opens daily from 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM. This market mainly offers a variety of fresh fish and seafood. Despite Japan's love for fish, this market stands out as the first fish market visited by many due to its smaller and more approachable atmosphere compared to the bustling Tokyo markets.
name: Hakodate Morning Market Ekini Market

excerpt: Forested park with hiking & cycling trails, campsites, a dormant volcano & boating on several lakes.
detail_description: Onuma Quasi-National Park, located just 20 kilometers north of Hakodate, is a picturesque forested park known for its island-dotted lakes and the majestic dormant volcano, Mount Komagatake. The park offers hiking and cycling trails, campsites, and boating opportunities on several lakes. It's easily accessible from Hakodate or Sapporo via limited express trains that stop at Onuma Koen Station.
name: Onuma National Park

excerpt: Cosmopolitan shopping street with international brands & boutiques, personal services & dining.
detail_description: Motomachi is a cosmopolitan shopping street featuring international brands, boutiques, personal services, and dining options. The district boasts Western-style architecture from the late nineteenth century, giving it a San Francisco vibe. Visitors can explore various churches in the area, including the striking white Russian Orthodox Church with green copper-clad onion domes and spires.
name: Motomachi

excerpt: Hakodate is one of the main cities on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island. Looming over the town is 334m-high Mount Hakodate. The mountain's summit, reachable by aerial ropeway gondola, offers dramatic nighttime views. At its base is Motomachi, a neighborhood of steep streets with Western-style, early-20th-century buildings. A city landmark is the grand Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward, built in 1910.
detail_description: Hakodate, located on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island, is a city known for its stunning attractions and sights. The 334m-high Mount Hakodate offers dramatic nighttime views from its summit, accessible by aerial ropeway gondola. The neighborhood of Motomachi features steep streets with early-20th-century Western-style buildings. A notable landmark is the grand Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward, built in 1910.
name: Hakodate

excerpt: Moated, star-shaped 1800s fort, now a leafy park with picnic areas & spring cherry blossom viewing.
detail_description: Goryokaku Park, located in the center of Hakodate city, is a former 1800s fort that has been transformed into a picturesque park with picnic areas and an abundance of cherry blossom trees. The park's star-shaped design holds historical significance as it was the site of the final battle between the old Shogunate army and the newly formed government forces. Visitors can explore restored ancient buildings within its premises, such as the Hakodate Magistrate's Office.
name: Goryokaku Park

excerpt: The Yunokawa Onsen is a well known onsen in Japan on the northern island of Hokkaidō. It is located on the outskirts of Hakodate city close to Hakodate Airport. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Yunokawa Onsen is a renowned hot spring destination located on the outskirts of Hakodate city in Hokkaido, Japan. It is conveniently close to Hakodate Airport and offers a string of hot springs along the coast, with public foot baths scattered throughout the area. Visitors can also explore the Hakodate Tropical Botanical Garden, home to 3,000 exotic plant species and famous for its hot-tubbing monkeys enjoying mineral baths.
name: Yunokawa Onsen

excerpt: Renovated civic building from 1910, with a period interior & harbor views from its balcony.
detail_description: The Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward is a beautifully renovated civic building dating back to 1910, showcasing elegant Western-style architecture influenced by the city's exposure to Western trade. This historical landmark offers stunning harbor views from its balcony and features a period interior that exudes the grandeur of European monarchs' palaces. Designated as a national important cultural property, the light yellow and light blue exterior adds to its charm.
name: Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward
address: 旧函館区公会堂内, 11-13 Motomachi, Hakodate, Hokkaido 040-0054, Japan

detail_description: Hakodate Morning Market Square is a bustling hub of activity from the early hours, making it an ideal spot for a delightful morning experience. Divided into several sections, this market near Hakodate Station offers a wide array of local breakfast options and takeout meals. Additionally, during the first six days of August, the area around the port comes alive with food stalls and vibrant festivities during the Hakodate port festival.
name: Hakodate Morning Market Square

excerpt: Park with cherry trees in a late-Edo period, 5-pointed star-shaped fortress with a moat.
detail_description: Goryōkaku is a late-Edo period fortress located in Hakodate, Japan. The star-shaped fort was built to defend Hokkaido against potential Russian attacks and was later used in a significant battle during the Meiji Restoration of 1869. Today, the park surrounding Goryōkaku is known for its beautiful cherry blossoms, making it a popular destination for visitors. Additionally, the night view from Mt.
name: Goryōkaku

detail_description: The Hakodate City Museum of Northern Peoples is a fascinating museum that focuses on the Ainu, Uilta, and Aleut peoples who inhabited the northern regions of Japan, Russia, and the Aleutian Islands. The museum showcases the traditional clothing and artifacts of these indigenous cultures, offering a glimpse into their lives in extremely cold climates.
name: Hakodate City Museum of Northern Peoples

excerpt: Tropical botanical garden featuring an airy greenhouse & monkeys bathing in a hot spring.
detail_description: Hakodate Tropical Botanical Garden is a must-visit destination near Yunokawa Hot Spring Resort. The garden features an airy greenhouse and is famous for its unique attraction - monkeys bathing in a hot spring to weather out the cold winter. This sight has become popular among visitors, offering an interesting experience. The clever Japanese macaques have learned to ward off the biting cold by soaking in the hot springs, creating a fascinating spectacle for tourists.
name: Hakodate Tropical Botanical Garden

excerpt: Scenic cliffside area, home to the tomb of poet Takuboku Ishikawa, with rugged coastal views.
detail_description: Cape Tachimachi, located southeast of Hakodate, offers breathtaking views of the Tsugaru Strait and Aomori on clear days. The area is home to the tomb of poet Takuboku Ishikawa and boasts rugged coastal scenery. Visitors can also enjoy horse racing at Hakodate Racecourse while taking in sea views. In addition to these attractions, there are several museums and memorial halls nearby.
name: Cape Tachimachi

excerpt: Circa-19th-century Russian Orthodox church with dramatic night lighting & a bell tower.
detail_description: Hakodate Orthodox Church, a stunning 19th-century Russian Orthodox church, is known for its dramatic night lighting and impressive bell tower. Situated in the vicinity of Mount Hakodate and other attractions like Goryokaku Park and Onuma Quasi-National Park, this iconic church offers a picturesque setting for visitors to explore. The area also features the bustling Hakodate Morning Market, where visitors can indulge in fresh seafood and capture memorable moments.
name: Hakodate Orthodox Church

excerpt: Historic diplomatic building with exhibits, an English garden & traditional afternoon tea service.
detail_description: Former British Consulate of Hakodate is a historic diplomatic building that offers visitors a glimpse into the unique combination of Japanese and Western cultures. The colonial architecture, with its cream facade and blue-framed windows, showcases evidence of Japanese influence in its design details. Despite being relatively new due to past fires that ravaged the city, it provides an intriguing look at the intersection of Eastern and Western styles. Additionally, the consulate features exhibits, an English garden, and even serves traditional afternoon tea.
name: Former British Consulate of Hakodate

excerpt: Narrow lanes lined with over 20 small eateries serving typical Japanese food & drink.
detail_description: Daimon Yokocho is a charming narrow alley near Hakodate's main train station, featuring over 20 small eateries serving a variety of Japanese cuisine and drinks. The food stall village offers an array of options from sushi to ramen, tempura to jingisukan (grilled mutton and vegetables), as well as Italian and French food. While some stalls are open during the day, Daimon Yokocho truly comes alive at night.
name: Daimon Yokocho

detail_description: Hakodate Station is a bustling hub for travelers, offering easy access to local attractions and transportation options. Nearby, visitors can savor the renowned dancing squid at Tabiji or explore the vibrant Daimon Yokocho with its array of street stalls serving up squid ramen and seafood-packed donburi rice bowls. The Hakodate morning market is a must-visit, brimming with fresh seafood until noon.
name: Hakodate Station

detail_description: Hachiman-Zaka Slope is a renowned attraction in Hakodate, known for its steep incline and stunning vistas. Named after the nearby Hakodate Hachiman Shrine, this stone-paved street is flanked by trees and offers panoramic views of the Hakodate Bay area and the distant Mashu Maru. Among the 19 sloping streets in Hakodate, Hachiman-Zaka is considered the most picturesque as it descends from Mount Hakodate to Hakodate Bay.
name: Hachiman-Zaka Slope

excerpt: International port built in the 19th century, with a deep harbor for cruise ships & large vessels.
detail_description: Hakodate Port is an international port with a deep harbor that can accommodate cruise ships and large vessels. The port comes alive during the Hakodate Port Festival, which takes place for six days at the beginning of August. Visitors can enjoy food stalls, fireworks shows, and traditional dances performed by locals.
name: Hakodate Port

detail_description: Former Soma Family Residence, also known as the Old Soma Residence, is a historic mansion in Hakodate built in 1908 by wealthy merchant Soma Teppei. The residence features a blend of Japanese and Western architectural styles and houses an art gallery called History Gallery showcasing Japanese drawings including those of Ainu. It is located next to Motomachi Park and offers visitors a glimpse into the lavish lifestyle of a prominent businessman through its well-preserved rooms, antique collections, and tranquil garden.
name: Former Soma Family Residence

excerpt: Small, historic Roman Catholic church featuring Gothic architecture & a bell tower.
detail_description: Catholic Church Hakodate Motomachi is a small, historic church known for its Gothic architecture and bell tower. The compact port city of Hakodate offers various attractions such as Victorian-era mansions in the Motomachi district, waterfront Beer Halls, Mount Hakodate ropeway, and Yunokawa Onsen. Visitors can explore the area by taking the Hakodate tram to Jujigai and strolling through historical churches and Western-style buildings like the Motomachi Roman Catholic Church.
name: Catholic Church Hakodate Motomachi
address: 元町教会, 15-30 Motomachi, Hakodate, Hokkaido 040-0054, Japan

detail_description: Lucky Pierrot Hakodate Ekimae branch is part of a unique hamburger restaurant chain in Hakodate City, known for its distinct and diverse store designs. Each location has its own theme and decor, making every visit a new experience. The Jujigai Ginza branch, designed by the president Ichiro Oh, features 5,000 Santa Claus figures creating a festive atmosphere year-round.
name: Lucky Pierrot Hakodate Ekimae branch

excerpt: Small, landscaped park backed by Mount Hakodate, with green lawns, flower beds & harbor views.
detail_description: Motomachi Park is a charming green space situated at the base of Mount Hakodate, offering picturesque views of the harbor. This historically significant site was once home to various important establishments, including the Hakodate Hachiman Shrine and the former Hokkaido government office. The surrounding area boasts several unique churches and well-preserved Western-style buildings, making it a delightful place for leisurely strolls.
name: Motomachi Park

excerpt: History exhibits shown in a restored Edo-period government structure with traditional architecture.
detail_description: The Hakodate Magistrate's Office is a restored Edo-period government building located in the center of Goryokaku. Originally constructed in 1864 at the foot of Mount Hakodate, it was later moved to its current location. After being dismantled following Japan's last civil war, the office was reconstructed from 2006 to 2010 and now stands as a charming rust-colored structure within Goryokaku Park.
name: Hakodate Magistrate's Office

detail_description: Hakodate Airport is the most convenient way to reach the port city, located just 8 kilometers to the east. Major airlines like JAL and ANA, along with budget carriers, offer daily flights from various airports across Japan. The airport boasts modern facilities including souvenir shops, lounges, and even a massage place for travelers' comfort.
name: Hakodate Airport

detail_description: Hachiman Zaka Slope is a picturesque cobblestone street in Kyoto, Japan, lined with traditional wooden houses and shops. The slope is famous for its stunning cherry blossoms in the spring and vibrant foliage in the fall. It offers a charming atmosphere that allows visitors to experience the old-world charm of Kyoto. Walking along Hachiman Zaka Slope provides an opportunity to immerse oneself in the rich history and culture of this ancient city.
name: Hachiman Zaka Slope

excerpt: Park founded in the 1800s known for spring cherry blossoms, theme park rides & a city museum.
detail_description: Hakodate Park, established in the 1800s, is renowned for its enchanting spring cherry blossoms and offers a charming atmosphere during this season. Despite its modest size, the park compensates with a delightful ambiance as yakitori stands sizzle beneath blooming cherry trees. Nestled at the base of Mount Hakodate near Aoyagicho Station, the park boasts walking paths that meander around a central fountain, providing shade under the sakura petals.
name: Hakodate Park

detail_description: Tea Shop Yūhi is a traditional teahouse located in Hakodate, offering matcha and wagashi while overlooking the ocean from its historic wooden building. The shop is housed in a converted 19th-century quarantine station and features an antique collection, including a German Polyphon music box. With its cozy atmosphere and scenic views of Hakodate Harbor, it provides an authentic Japanese tea experience.
name: Tea Shop Yūhi

detail_description: Hakodate Beer Brewery is a must-visit spot in Hakodate, known for its revival dating back to 1898. The brewery still operates on-site today, using the natural groundwater of Mount Hakodate as a secret ingredient for their signature pilsner and other inventive brews like Hakodate Ichigo no Hatsu Koi, made with seasonal Hokkaido strawberries.
name: Hakodate Beer
address: 明治館通り, 5-22 Otemachi, Hakodate, Hokkaido 040-0064, Japan

detail_description: The Kanemori Red Brick Warehouse, located in the Bay Area of Hakodate, is a must-visit spot with its retro ambiance and historical significance as an actual warehouse. The area offers stunning city views and a charming atmosphere with seagulls and sea breezes. Visitors can explore unique shops offering interesting items not commonly found elsewhere. Additionally, the adjacent Starbucks location is worth checking out.
name: Kanemori Red Brick Warehouse - Bay Hakodate
address: 金森赤レンガ倉庫, 11-5 Toyokawacho, Hakodate, Hokkaido 040-0065, Japan

excerpt: Cable car boarding & disembarking point for a modern tramway to the top of Mount Hakodate.
detail_description: The Mt. Hakodate Ropeway, also known as the Mountain Base Station, is a modern tramway that takes passengers up to the top of Mount Hakodate, a 334-meter-high inactive volcanic mountain. The gondola can accommodate up to 125 people and offers a quick 3-minute journey to the summit, providing stunning panoramic views of the city, port, and beaches below.
name: Mt. Hakodate Ropeway - Mountain Base Station

excerpt: Maritime museum on a ship, with models, mechanical information, tours & a coffee shop.
detail_description: The Hakodate City Seikan Train Ferry Memorial Museum Mashū-maru is a maritime museum located on a ship that offers visitors an immersive experience into Hakodate's maritime history. The museum is housed in the Mashu Maru, a former railway ferry that connected Hokkaido and Honshu until the construction of the Seikan Tunnel. Visitors can explore models, mechanical information, and take tours while enjoying a coffee shop onboard.
name: Hakodate City Seikan Train Ferry Memorial Museum Mashū-maru

excerpt: Landscaped park with a tea-room garden, an artificial stream & a greenhouse, plus lawns for sports.
detail_description: This park is located in the municipality of Hirakawa-shi, near the city of Sapporo. The garden was first established as an Iwafune Garden in the early 20th century, and has since been expanded to include a tea-room garden, artificial stream and greenhouse. The park also includes lawns for sports.
name: Miharashi Park

excerpt: Lush volcanic mountain with hiking trails, panoramic views, hot springs & a nearby shrine.
detail_description: Nestled an hour's drive east of Hakodate, Mount Esan is a verdant volcanic marvel and a prominent natural attraction in southern Hokkaido. The well-maintained trails lead adventurers 618 meters up to the summit, where sulfuric fumes mingle with blooming flora. At its base lies Mizunashi Kaihin Onsen, a unique hot spring featuring two natural pools blending ocean waves and mineral-rich waters along the pristine coastline.
name: Mount E

excerpt: Low-key, forested ski resort with a cable car & mountaintop cafe, plus summer hiking trails.
detail_description: Hakodate Nanae Snow Park is a serene ski resort nestled in a forested area, just an hour's drive from Hakodate. It offers a cable car ride to a mountaintop cafe with breathtaking views and summer hiking trails. The park is located near Onuma Quasi National Park and provides opportunities for sledding, snow play, and gondola lift rides to enjoy the magnificent scenery.
name: Hakodate Nanae Snow Park
address: 666 Higashionuma, Nanae, Kameda District, Hokkaido 041-1351, Japan

detail_description: When in Hakodate, make sure to visit the iconic Lucky Pierrot Bay Area Main Shop, a retro-cute burger chain with 17 outlets across the city. This popular spot draws inspiration from 1950s American diners and offers a unique selection of delicious burgers that are hard to resist. The environment is highly praised, offering sea-facing dining and quick service at affordable prices.
name: Lucky Pierrot Bay Area Main Shop

detail_description: It is a museum dedicated to Takuboku Ishikawa and Hakodate writers, with displays of items and manuscripts related to the author. The curator will provide an introduction to the writers and their works, even if you don't know much about literature. You are not allowed to take pictures inside the building.
name: Hakodate City Museum of Literature

detail_description: Donburi Yokocho Seafood restaurant avenue, located near the Hakodate morning market, is a must-visit for food enthusiasts. This arcade houses around 20 shops where you can indulge in the local delicacy known as kaisendon, a delectable seafood rice bowl. The dish features a bed of steaming white rice topped with incredibly fresh seafood such as salmon roe, sea urchin, and crab.
name: Donburi Yokocho Seafood restaurant avenue (hakodate morning market)

detail_description: Hakodate Ramen Houran is a traditional ramen shop in Hokkaido, Japan, known for its light and salty Hakodate-style ramen. The broth is flavored with kelp or seafood, giving it a unique taste that sets it apart from other regional varieties. Established in 1950, this simple and affordable eatery offers set meals that pair their signature ramen with curry rice.
name: Hakodate Ramen Houran

detail_description: Milkissimo - Goryokaku Tower Shop is a classy ice cream parlor known for its elegant and distinctly Japanese flavors made from milk sourced from Hakodate farms. The chic location at Kanemori Red Brick Warehouse showcases colorful soft serve ice creams with a wide range of flavors, including black sesame, green tea, purple sweet potato, cherry blossom with salted cherry leaf, Hokkaido Berry (Northern Haskap), Arancia Rossa, mango, and melon.
name: MILKISSIMO - Goryokaku Tower Shop

detail_description: Hakodate Racecourse is a great place for families to enjoy horse racing and various activities. During weekends in the summer, visitors can watch horse races on a big screen and participate in children's events with horses. The racecourse also features playground equipment and local food stalls, making it an interesting destination for both horse enthusiasts and families looking for a fun day out. Whether or not there are races happening, the racecourse offers a cool experience for anyone interested in getting closer to these majestic animals.
name: Hakodate Racecourse

excerpt: Established by 8 French nuns in 1898, this peaceful convent is still an active nunnery today.
detail_description: Our Lady of the Angels Trappistine Abbey, founded by 8 French nuns in 1898, is a serene convent that continues to be active today. The elegant French-style architecture and a small shop featuring works by the sisters make it a must-visit destination. While some areas are off-limits due to its functioning as a nunnery, visitors can still enjoy the beautiful garden and architecture.
name: Our Lady of the Angels Trappistine Abbey
The First Concrete Electricity Pole In Japan

detail_description: Hakodatesei John Church, also known as St. John Church, is a striking cross-shaped Anglican church located in Motomachi. Founded by an English priest, this Episcopalian establishment offers a commanding view of the city. While its modern architecture may be a bit polarizing, visitors appreciate the peaceful and cozy atmosphere it provides. Although closed during some visits, the exterior features a sign detailing its history.
name: Hakodatesei John Church
address: 聖ヨハネ教会, 3-23 Motomachi, Hakodate, Hokkaido 040-0054, Japan

excerpt: Far-reaching views of the city, bay & strait from a mountaintop platform reached by cable car.
detail_description: Mt. Hakodate Observatory offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city, bay, and strait from a mountaintop platform accessible by cable car. Visitors recommend experiencing the stunning night view and suggest visiting in the evening to witness the spectacular fireworks at 6pm. Despite potential cold and windy conditions, the observatory's souvenir shop and cafe provide opportunities to enjoy delicious treats while taking in the million-dollar view.
name: Mt. Hakodate Observatory

excerpt: Small shrine with a row of red torii gates, known for dispensing fortunes tied around paper squids.
detail_description: Yukura Shrine is a charming and serene shrine located at the "birthplace" of Yunokawa Onsen. It is adorned with a row of striking red torii gates and is known for dispensing fortunes tied around paper squids. The shrine offers a wide range of benefits, including blessings for land management, medical care, hot springs, cultivation, good harvests, prosperous businesses, family safety, and marriage.
name: Yukura Shrine

excerpt: Calm Shinto shrine set in a forest, founded in 1445 with a main hall of more recent construction.
detail_description: Hakodate Hachimangu Shrine, nestled at the base of Mt. Hakodate, is a serene Shinto shrine founded in 1445. The shrine's traditional buildings are surrounded by lush forest, creating a tranquil and spiritual atmosphere. It is a popular destination during Japan's New Year holidays and hosts a vibrant summer festival. Nearby attractions include Tachimachi Cape and foreign cemeteries, making it an ideal location for leisurely walks after visiting the shrine.
name: Hakodate Hachimangu
